intro: Chrysoscias grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered chrysoscia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
